meanings.definition: To clear the throat loudly in a self-important manner.
meanings.sent1: He harrumphed before speaking, trying to sound important.
meanings.sent2: She harrumphed loudly to get everyone's attention.
meanings.sent3: The cat harrumphed as if it owned the place, demanding treats.
meanings.sent4: The old car harrumphed and sputtered before finally starting.
meanings.sent5: The teacher harrumphed to silence the chatty students.

meanings.definition: To express disapproval or annoyance with a snort or grunt.
meanings.sent1: Dad harrumphed when he saw the messy room.
meanings.sent2: The audience harrumphed at the boring performance.
meanings.sent3: The baby harrumphed at the strange taste of the food.
meanings.sent4: The engine harrumphed in protest as it struggled up the hill.
meanings.sent5: The boss harrumphed at the late report, clearly displeased.
